meta.hint:
Use 'is' if the sentence is about one person, animal, place, or, thing.
Example - Richard is funny. Example - It is brittle.
Use 'are' if the sentence is about more than one person, animal, place or thing. Also, use 'are' if the sentence is about you.
Example - Jake and Ron are late. Example - We are behind you. Example - You are so pretty.
Use 'am' if the sentence is about I. Example - I am not going there.
meta.question: Complete the sentence with the correct present tense form.

content.description: Your books _____ scattered on the table.
